intro: Ranunculus sinovaginatus, commonly known as the Chinese buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features delicate, palmately divided leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
